paragraphs.content: The Epistle of Paul to Philemon
paragraphs.contentHtml: <small>The Epistle of Paul to</small> Philemon

paragraphs.content: Chapter 1
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 1

paragraphs.content: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, unto Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellowlabourer,

paragraphs.content: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:
paragraphs.contentHtml: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

paragraphs.content: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

paragraphs.content: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,
paragraphs.contentHtml: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

paragraphs.content: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;
paragraphs.contentHtml: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all saints;

paragraphs.content: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.
paragraphs.contentHtml: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

paragraphs.content: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

paragraphs.content: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wherefore, though I might be much bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient,

paragraphs.content: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yet for love’s sake I rather beseech thee, being such an one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

paragraphs.content: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:
paragraphs.contentHtml: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

paragraphs.content: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

paragraphs.content: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, mine own bowels:

paragraphs.content: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:
paragraphs.contentHtml: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered unto me in the bonds of the gospel:

paragraphs.content: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But without thy mind would I do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

paragraphs.content: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;
paragraphs.contentHtml: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldest receive him for ever;

paragraphs.content: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more unto thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

paragraphs.content: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If thou count me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

paragraphs.content: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;
paragraphs.contentHtml: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee ought, put that on mine account;

paragraphs.content: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I Paul have written it with mine own hand, I will repay it: albeit I do not say to thee how thou owest unto me even thine own self besides.

paragraphs.content: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Yea, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

paragraphs.content: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote unto thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

paragraphs.content: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But withal prepare me also a lodging: for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given unto you.

paragraphs.content: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
paragraphs.contentHtml: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;

paragraphs.content: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellowlabourers.

paragraphs.content: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Written from Rome to Philemon, by Onesimus a servant.
